meaningInfo: This version of <kanji>I</kanji> is more boyish. It's a sort of young man/boy way of saying "I," though you'll hear women use it too sometimes (it's a teensy bit tomboyish though).
readingMnemonic: You use the word <kanji>I</kanji> a lot. You say it so much, you just start referring to yourself with the french <reading>beaucoup</reading> (<ja>ぼく</ja>) for a lot. Because you love yourself a lot.
readingInfo: I am beaucoup I am. (Is that a pun? Did I do it right?) I dunno. Just say <ja>ぼく</ja> a lot and try to connect all of your approximate knowledges of languages together. Merci <ja>ぼく</ja> from <ja>ぼく</ja>.
